comment: Took her for Strength of Materials Lab. I enjoyed her labs. She's very clear on what she wants on lab reports so its hard to not get an A. The midterm and final are not too hard either if you pay attention.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Pros: Pretty nice person and cares about what she is teaching. Lecture class was straight forward and the tests were very doable. Cons: Unbelievably sassy, heaven forbid you ask a question that is already answered on the syllabus or in a mass email a few weeks earlier. Lab reports were graded to a very picky standard. Difficult to get an A
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: A Fantastic professor. Excellent use of real-world examples in lectures. She cares about her students and is incredibly kind. She always goes an extra mile for her students, whether that is preparing notes and course material or answering questions during office hours. The class is difficult but rewarding. Homework is mandatory.

Great professor. Application based teaching, with lots of examples. Gives a good bit of homework but if you do the homework you will pass the exams. Exams reflect material covered and Turner grades fairly.

Turner is a good professor. I had her for strengths lecture and she does lots of examples which is really helpful! I also had her for construction materials lab (but not lecture) and for those of us who did not have her lecture class (our prof was not good) she would teach us everything at the beginning of lab which was very helpful.

She is great for lecture but she is really tough on the lab so beware of taking her lab class. She takes off points for the smallest errors like spelling and grammar but at the end of the day she wants you to learn how to write a report professionally so I admire Professor Turner for that. She is not a bad professor for lab or lecture. Just tough.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria

comment: Provides lecture notes so no reason to use the textbook other than for homework. She assigns so many homework questions and I suggest you do them all. If you do them all, the tests will be so much easier. 3 test and a department final and department final is brutal. She started giving quizzes this semester via d2l (3 quizzes) so be prepared.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Great professor. Very clear, great notes, tests are moderate but if you study and know the concepts you'll do fine. Make sure you don't count on the final to save your grade because it's much harder than the tests.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Had Turner for Strength Materials and as a lab professor for Construction Materials. Good lecturer; exams are easy; homework is  points on exam; do homework and pay attention  easy pass. Gives lots of notes and example problems. Application based. Even better lab professor. .
Very good professor, the strength class begins easy. Especially the first test and after that it gets tough if you don't learn the material well
She goes through the material fast but gives handouts for everything she covers. She grades the test very liberally. Do all the homework and study and you should get an easy A.

Strength of Materials. She's a really good professor. Handouts are clear and are literally everything you need to know. The book will mainly be used for homework. Homework is due the next test and counts for bonus credit and/or test grade %. Grading is very fair though labs are graded moderately. Study hard and put effort in.
Excellent professor who makes sure you understand. I wish all professors were just like Mrs. Turner! Take her class!!
Great teacher! She teaches directly from the textbook so little note taking is needed. She is very good at explaining things and as long as you do the homework the class will be easy.
Statics. This teacher is awsome! She is extremely helpful and covers the material well.  I would recommend her for any and all classes.

Great professor, knew material very well. Exams were easier than homework. This class had lab reports which would made you hate life after you were done. She is very kind with grading which made it worth it. You will have to go to class as she takes roll.
